snippet: IMAGINE a world where men and women are, in fact, created equal. They have matching mental and physical skills and comparable opportunities for advancement. Are the two sexes in this world equally valued?      Not even in fantasyland. Turns out th...
lead_paragraph: IMAGINE a world where men and women are, in fact, created equal. They have matching mental and physical skills and comparable opportunities for advancement. Are the two sexes in this world equally valued? Not even in fantasyland. Turns out the women there are less highly valued -- 10 percent less, anyway. New research by Edward Castronova, an associate professor of economics at California State University at Fullerton, indicates that people pay $40 to $55 more for the male characters that they use to represent themselves in the popular online fantasy role-playing game EverQuest.
abstract: Study by Prof Edward Castronova, California State University, finds that video games featuring female characters known as avatars sell for less than those using males, even though there are no differences in capabilities; photos (M)

snippet: Faced with the college's mandate that fraternity women receive full membership privileges, Bowdoin College's Alpha Delta Phi chapter this month became the last of four fraternities on campus to sacrifice national affiliation rather than lose colle...
lead_paragraph: Faced with the college's mandate that fraternity women receive full membership privileges, Bowdoin College's Alpha Delta Phi chapter this month became the last of four fraternities on campus to sacrifice national affiliation rather than lose college recognition. The university administration's policy of integrating women more fully into campus life, including the Greek system, presented a tough choice for fraternities like Alpha Delta Phi, whose national organizations do not recognize women as members. The fraternities had to decide by the first of this month.

headline.main: CAMPUS LIFE: Bowdoin; Fraternity Members Give Female Members Equal Standing

snippet: A woman who spent time on death row for her part in killing a family of five said she believed that Karla Faye Tucker, scheduled to be executed on Feb. 3, should live.    The woman, Linda May Burnett, said: ''If I can do this, come in the prison s...
lead_paragraph: A woman who spent time on death row for her part in killing a family of five said she believed that Karla Faye Tucker, scheduled to be executed on Feb. 3, should live. The woman, Linda May Burnett, said: ''If I can do this, come in the prison system, and I can live in peace with other people and I can reach out and help out younger people around me, I believe in my heart Karla can. I think Karla is a better person than I am.''
abstract: Linda May Burnett, who spent time on death row for participating in killing of family of five, pleads for life of Karla Faye Tucker, who is scheduled to die on February 3 for her part in killing of two people in Houston, Tex, in 1983 (S)

lead_paragraph: Inspired by a Duke University woman's handbook, 35 Barnard and Columbia College women have released a woman's handbook of their own, 102 pages covering everything from "coming out" as a lesbian to eating disorders. "As we were writing this book we were amazed that all of this did not exist in one place that was accessible to women," said Carla Richmond, a Columbia College senior and, as a founder of the Barnard/Columbia Women's Handbook Collective, a coordinator of the project.

snippet: FRANKENBERG--Babette Meyers Known to her family and many friends as "Bobbe," died February 28 at age 98, having lived a richly variegated and adventurous life that channeled her pioneering spirit as a feminist before her time. Bobbe was born on Ma...
lead_paragraph: FRANKENBERG--Babette Meyers Known to her family and many friends as "Bobbe," died February 28 at age 98, having lived a richly variegated and adventurous life that channeled her pioneering spirit as a feminist before her time. Bobbe was born on May 16, 1916, in the hardscrabble mining town of Bisbee, AZ, and moved with her parents to Beverly Hills when Sunset Boulevard had yet to be fully paved. She was a successful business woman in the 1940s, when female entrepreneurs were a rare breed, and through the 1980s, as women increasingly rose to prominence in corporate America. She found great success in commercial and residential real estate as well in public relations. In the 1950s she handled Mark Taper's PR for his ambitious Lakewood development. With Coldwell Banker, Bobbe sold many of the more remarkable Los Angeles homes of her time, remarkable both for their lavishness and their residents. Bobbe was also an outdoors woman and athlete, fishing and riding horses. She skied and played tennis competitively, often against men. She raised and trained dogs and was a sports car enthusiast, well-known for the rainbow-painted Porsche in which she made her real estate rounds. Bobbe traveled widely throughout Europe, Asia, Africa and the Americas. As a patron of the arts she greatly enjoyed classical music and in recent years, Lady Gaga. Her rapier wit and playful sense of humor was matched by her care and concern for others. Never one to talk about herself, Bobbe focused her incandescent personality on whomever she was with; her joyful presence absorbed as much as her quiet smile radiated. Bobbe leaves behind friends and classmates from Beverly Hills High School (1935, Class President), UC Berkeley and UCLA (1939, BA European History). She will be dearly missed by her family, including her niece Jeanne Meyers (Richard Carr) and nephews Charles Franklin (Susie) and Wayne Franklin (Susan); her grandnieces and nephews, Elissa (Clark Middleton) and Lucas Meyers (Margaret); Zachary Franklin (Sofia Zander), Seth Franklin (Kristin), Judd Franklin (Tybe Goldberg); and Jason Franklin, Barrett Franklin (Lea) and Shannon Hegarty (Terry); as well as by her great grandnieces and nephew, Ellington and August Meyers; Molly Franklin and Clara Zander; and Adena Franklin. Bobbe was predeceased by her younger brothers Benny (Ben Jr.) (same day as Bobbe, February 28, but 1973) and Maynard Franklin (2011). Beneficiaries of Babette's profoundly philanthropic nature include several health and educational institutes. She and her brother Maynard left the gem and mineral collection originally amassed by their parents, Ben and Clara, in Bisbee, to the Los Angeles County Museum of Natural History, where it can now be seen by all. 1

headline.main: Paid Notice: Memorials  FRANKENBERG, BABETTE MEYERS KNOWN TO HER FAMILY AND MANY FRIENDS AS "BOBBE," DIED FEBRUARY 28 AT AGE 98, HAVING LIVED A RICHLY VARIEGATED AND ADVENTUROUS LIFE THAT CHANNELED HER PIONEERING SPIRIT AS A FEMINIST BEFORE HER TIME. BOBBE WAS BORN ON MAY 16, 1916, IN THE HARDSCRABBLE MINING TOWN OF BISBEE, AZ, AND MOVED WITH HER PARENTS TO BEVERLY HILLS WHEN SUNSET BOULEVARD HAD YET TO BE FULLY PAVED. SHE WAS A SUCCESSFUL BUSINESS WOMAN IN THE 1940S, WHEN FEMALE ENTREPRENEURS WERE A RARE BREED, AND THROUGH THE 1980S, AS WOMEN INCREASINGLY ROSE TO PROMINENCE IN CORPORATE AMERICA. SHE FOUND GREAT SUCCESS IN COMMERCIAL AND RESIDENTIAL REAL ESTATE AS WELL IN PUBLIC RELATIONS. IN THE 1950S SHE HANDLED MARK TAPER'S PR FOR HIS AMBITIOUS LAKEWOOD DEVELOPMENT. WITH COLDWELL BANKER, BOBBE SOLD MANY OF THE MORE REMARKABLE LOS ANGELES HOMES OF HER TIME, REMARKABLE BOTH FOR THEIR LAVISHNESS AND THEIR RESIDENTS. BOBBE WAS ALSO AN OUTDOORS WOMAN AND ATHLETE, FISHING AND RIDING HORSES. SHE SKIED AND PLAYED TENNIS COMPETITIVELY, OFTEN AGAINST MEN. SHE RAISED AND TRAINED DOGS AND WAS A SPORTS CAR ENTHUSIAST, WELL, KNOWN FOR THE RAINBOW, PAINTED PORSCHE IN WHICH SHE MADE HER REAL ESTATE ROUNDS. BOBBE TRAVELED WIDELY THROUGHOUT EUROPE, ASIA, AFRICA AND THE AMERICAS. AS A PATRON OF THE ARTS SHE GREATLY ENJOYED CLASSICAL MUSIC AND IN RECENT YEARS, LADY GAGA. HER RAPIER WIT AND PLAYFUL SENSE OF HUMOR WAS MATCHED BY HER CARE AND CONCERN FOR OTHERS. NEVER ONE TO TALK ABOUT HERSELF, BOBBE FOCUSED HER INCANDESCENT PERSONALITY ON WHOMEVER SHE WAS WITH; HER JOYFUL PRESENCE ABSORBED AS MUCH AS HER QUIET SMILE RADIATED. BOBBE LEAVES BEHIND FRIENDS AND CLASSMATES FROM BEVERLY HILLS HIGH SCHOOL (1935, CLASS PRESIDENT), UC BERKELEY AND UCLA (1939, BA EUROPEAN HISTORY). SHE WILL BE DEARLY MISSED BY HER FAMILY, INCLUDING HER NIECE JEANNE MEYERS (RICHARD CARR) AND NEPHEWS CHARLES FRANKLIN (SUSIE) AND WAYNE FRANKLIN (SUSAN); HER GRANDNIECES AND NEPHEWS, ELISSA (CLARK MIDDLETON) AND LUCAS MEYERS (MARGARET); ZACHARY FRANKLIN (SOFIA ZANDER), SETH FRANKLIN (KRISTIN), JUDD FRANKLIN (TYBE GOLDBERG); AND JASON FRANKLIN, BARRETT FRANKLIN (LEA) AND SHANNON HEGARTY (TERRY); AS WELL AS BY HER GREAT GRANDNIECES AND NEPHEW, ELLINGTON AND AUGUST MEYERS; MOLLY FRANKLIN AND CLARA ZANDER; AND ADENA FRANKLIN. BOBBE WAS PREDECEASED BY HER YOUNGER BROTHERS BENNY (BEN JR.) (SAME DAY AS BOBBE, FEBRUARY 28, BUT 1973) AND MAYNARD FRANKLIN (2011). BENEFICIARIES OF BABETTE'S PROFOUNDLY PHILANTHROPIC NATURE INCLUDE SEVERAL HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTES. SHE AND HER BROTHER MAYNARD LEFT THE GEM AND MINERAL COLLECTION ORIGINALLY AMASSED BY THEIR PARENTS, BEN AND CLARA, IN BISBEE, TO THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY, WHERE IT CAN NOW BE SEEN BY ALL. 1

lead_paragraph: NATURAL SCIENCE,-A course of lectures on this subject will be delivered by Prof. R. OGDEN DOREMUS at the Academy of Music, Brooklyn, commencng Tuesday, April 17. The lectures will be given under the auspices of the Brooklyn Mercantile Library Association, and will be illustrated by experiments which have rarely been exhibited in public on account of the expense attending them.

headline.main: BROOKLYN NEWS.; VIEWS OF LIFE THROUGH THE MEDIUM OF NATURAL SCIENCE.--A course of lectures on this sub- NATURAL SCIENCE. FELONIOUS ASSAULT BY A CAVALRYMAN. ALLEGED RECEIVER OF STOLEN GOODS. ANOTHER FATAL RAILROAD ACCIDENT. FEMALE 'PICKPOCKETS. INFANTICIDE.

snippet: The schooner Ozdie, Captain MARVIN, master, arrived at Racine, Wisconsin, yesterday morning, from Marquette, Lake Superior, having on board a young lady, Miss SOPHIA RICHARDSON, formerly of Cleveland, Ohio, who for the last three years has been li...
lead_paragraph: The schooner Ozdie, Captain MARVIN, master, arrived at Racine, Wisconsin, yesterday morning, from Marquette, Lake Superior, having on board a young lady, Miss SOPHIA RICHARDSON, formerly of Cleveland, Ohio, who for the last three years has been living in solitude upon a desointe and un??hablied island in Lake Superior, near the British Coast, and northwest from Is'e Royal upon which she was east away in the Spring of 1850.

headline.main: A CURIOUS STORY.; A Female Robinson Crusoe--A Young Lady Rescued after Living Three Years upon a Desolate and Uninhabited Island In Lake Superior--Sketch of her Shipwreck, her Life on the Island and her Rescue.

snippet: A female yapock, just arrived in this country from Costa Rica, where she was captured by a crew of natives under the direction of Collector Charles Cordier, will appear in public for the first time today in the small mammal house at the Bronx Zoo....
lead_paragraph: A female yapock, just arrived in this country from Costa Rica, where she was captured by a crew of natives under the direction of Collector Charles Cordier, will appear in public for the first time today in the small mammal house at the Bronx Zoo.

headline.main: Bronx Zoo Gets a Female Yapock, 'Rarest Animal of the Americas'; Captured by Natives in Jungle of Costa Rica -- She Likes Night Life, so Visitors May Find Her Asleep Today

snippet: A few hours before dawn yesterday morning one of the patient martyrs of the war died at the Presbyterian Hospital. Her death ended one of the most cruel sieges of suffering that a woman was ever called on to undergo for the sake of her country's s...
lead_paragraph: A few hours before dawn yesterday morning one of the patient martyrs of the war died at the Presbyterian Hospital. Her death ended one of the most cruel sieges of suffering that a woman was ever called on to undergo for the sake of her country's service. Her work had not been of the sort that wins the server a nation's admiration.
abstract: Death

snippet: Lieutenant-General WINFIELD SCOTT departed yesterday on his mission of pacification to tile Pacific. The pier at the foot of Warren-street, North River, from which it had been announced that the General would sail in the Star of the West at 2 P. M...
lead_paragraph: Lieutenant-General WINFIELD SCOTT departed yesterday on his mission of pacification to tile Pacific. The pier at the foot of Warren-street, North River, from which it had been announced that the General would sail in the Star of the West at 2 P. M., was crowded with people long before that hour, and every available spot on the adjacent wharves and shipping was occupied.

headline.main: Departure of Lieutenant-General Scott for the Pacific.; PARADE OF THE SCOTT LIFE GUARD--SALUTE OF THIRTY-THREE GUNS--SALVOS FROM THE FORTS IN THE BAY--A FEMALE PICKPOCKET.

snippet: Daniella Zalcman has put together a website featuring the photojournalism work of hundreds of women. She wants to show editors that there’s “not a shortage of women photographers, just a lack of equitable hiring.”...
lead_paragraph: In 1973, Sara Krulwich visited 29 newspapers, looking for a job after graduating from the University of Michigan. She met with male photo editors who mostly scoffed at the idea of a woman as a news photographer. One editor, she said, told her that hiring a woman was like “hiring half a person.”
abstract: Daniella Zalcman has put together a website featuring the photojournalism work of hundreds of women. She wants to show editors that there’s “not a shortage of women photographers, just a lack of equitable hiring.”

headline.main: Highlighting Women in Photojournalism

abstract: Saudi Arabia will allow female athletes to compete in the Olympics for the first time in 2012 if they qualify.

snippet: Researchers have lately gathered evidence that female friendship is one of nature’s preferred narrative tools....
lead_paragraph: Researchers have lately gathered evidence that female friendship is one of nature’s preferred narrative tools.
abstract: Growing body of research points to friendship between females as the basic unit of social life across a wide spectrum of animal species; females with strong same-gender bonds, from primates to elephants, have lower levels of stress hormones, live significantly longer and rear a greater number of offspring to independence than do their less socialized peers.

headline.seo: How HBO’s ‘Girls’ Mirrors the Spirit of Sisterhood in Nature
headline.main: The Spirit of Sisterhood Is in the Air and on the Air
headline.print_headline: The Spirit of Sisterhood Is in the Air and On Air

snippet: Every participating nation at the London Olympics is expected to field at least one female athlete, including Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Brunei, which have previously sent only male competitors....
lead_paragraph: Every participating nation at the London Olympics is expected to field at least one female athlete, including Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Brunei, which have previously sent only male competitors.
abstract: Saudi Crown Prince Nayef bin Abdul Aziz approves the participation of female athletes in 2012 Olympics as long as their sports do not interfere with Islamic laws; Qatar and Brunei have previously signaled an interest in sending female athletes to London.

headline.seo: Saudi Arabia May Allow Women to Compete at 2012 London Olympics
headline.main: Saudi Arabia May Include Women on Its Olympic Team
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia May Send Women to Olympics
